151.content:
The dragon laid back, resting as her belly hung up in the air. She relaxed hapilly, as her son, Kusein, slept peacefully on her large stomach. Her son snuggled into the fat he was resting on, a young Devourer born just barely a week ago.

There was still something she had to do. Being so young, he wouldn't have the metabolism that turned Devourers into the iconic fat dragons that they were.

She let her belly sink lower as she breathed out deeply, letting her offspring roll towards her head. She opened her mouth as the hatchling squealed in happiness, enjoying this as a game. He tumbled into her mouth, resting on her tongue.

With a quick swallow, she swallowed her child into her belly. Kusien had to remain there for at least a month, so that his metabolism would adjust to a life style of lazing and eating.

She rolled over onto her belly, and pushed herself up, experiencing the familar dificulty that came with such a large gut. Her back legs were padded with fat, along with some on her front legs. Her belly barely scrapped across the ground, creating a trail that could barely be seen in the dirt. She needed to find something for herself and her son to eat.

After struggling to leave her cave due to her belly being caught in the entrance once again. As she traveled, she found a rather large herd of deer, something that she enjoyed particularly. She beat her enourmous wings, slowly lifting up off the ground on wings meant to carry much larger. She hovered above the group, positioning herself so that they would be trapped, but not killed when she dropped herself.

Her belly softened the fall, and the fat pinned the deer underneath. As she moved away, she took a count of how many she had successfully stunned. the final count was roughly 15, less than she was used to, but more than enough to get her son used to.

She moved her head over, and thanks to her long neck, lapped up ten of the deer and swallowed them whole. She pulled the other five into her mouth and bit down hard, crushing bones and letting blood gush out over her mouth as she chewed up the meat for Kusien. She swallowed and let the prechewed fall into the same sack that was holding her son.


Kusien wondered what kind of game his mommy was playing with him. He ran around the inside of her belly, gently knawing on the walls with his under-developed teeth. he soon grew bored and curled up to try and go to sleep.

He felt a sudden surge as his mother slammed into the ground, and wondered what was going on. The larger fat dragon began to swallow various things, and wondered if he was getting a playmate.

Suddenly, a batch of shapeless meat fell into the stomach that he was in. Kusien squealed happily as he dug into the contents of the meal he was given. As he finshed his meal, he laid on his back and pawed at his spherical belly, packed tight with his meal. Kusien fell asleep as the cycle repaeted itself constantly.


At the end of one month, Kusien's mother wondered what her son looked like. She began to retch as she worked on regurgitating her son. A msmall bulge could be seen on her padded neck, and she felt the hatchling enter her jaw.

He was softer, and larger to.

She let him drop onto the ground and got a good look at him. He was around the size of one of those domesticated wolves that humans kept, and looked very bloated. His own belly came into full contact with the ground, as that is where most of the fat ended up.

She knew that he would leave, as food to maintain him would not soon be enough for both her and him. He would have to lear how to hunt, fend for himself and how to find a mate. She had to get to work now for him to be ready...

15121.content:
Kusien chuckled at his friend's absurdity. "You did not! He's just some legend."

A sharp kick came from deep in his belly, making the Devourer keel over, clutching his stomach with a paw.

"I'm telling you, he is real! I told him to follow me this way so he could meet you!"

"So...what is this 'Silver-Haired Devourer' like?"

"Well, I'm not FULLY a Devourer." A new voice said.

Kusien jumped when he saw the imposing figure. He was nearl twice as tall as Kusien, and his scales shone brightly, contrasting with the bright blue of Kusien's own scales. This dragon's scales were like the extremely rare metal, platinum, and were more than likely just as valuable. He was MASSIVE! The belly hung out in a way that Kusein had not seen before, and all of his appendages had their own generous deposits.

"So...you're Kusien right?" The dragon asked.

"The...the...the Silver Haired Devourer!?" Kusien said in shock.

"Well, I guess...I prefer to be called Dasuke, after it is my name," Dasuke held out a paw as he introduced himself.

"...Dasuke? As in THE Dasuke that defeated the demented Half-God? The same one, said to be the LAST Halfling in existance!?" Kusein asked.

"Uh...yes?" Dasuke said sheepishly. "It wasn't just me after all, and that was years ago...I don't do much now..." He nervously rubbed his belly.

"Really? Well, what DO you do then?"

"Mainly eat...the recent years have made my Devourer half much stronger...so much that I...well, look like this." Dasuke smiled with slight blush.

"Wow...Though I've never seen someone as big as you...except maybe my mother."

"Well, I'm still relatively small for a Devourer, after all, some can grow up to hundreds of feet tall, and hundreds of tons as well. I'm only seven tons or so. So, since I'm here, want to do something with me? I'll let you decide." Dasuke smiled and leaned over to pat Kusien

"In all my years as a traveler I wouldn't of found a place like this. What's the name of this place?" Dasuke asked.

Kusien lifts himself off the ground and lands on a deer instantly killing it under his girth. Soon two new deer appear from some sort of magical rift.

"Whoa! You don't see that happen everyday. I think I've heard of places like these. They're said to be enchanted with magical gems that give the land renewing power. Yet my friend would know so much more about it since she's a great scholar."

"That's interesting. Here take this. The food is on me so sit back and relax."

"What about you? Shouldn't a young Devourer get something to eat as well?"

"I'm fine. I had breakfast two hours ago. I'll probably get something to eat in a bit. I like to work up an appetite first. Just let me know when you had your fill."

Kusien then hunts down deer and gives it to Dasuke.

He whimpered softly, thinking on what crazed scene he had just witnessed back at his home. 'Damn them! I will kill every knight in this town or its my life I shall kill!' The tears rolled down your scales silently as the thoughts of what just happened agian filled your mind.

You could hear your mother, shouting those ill fated words at you. "Run! Fly away and neverr come back!" Then half of your small house exploded into flames and your mother and father rammed an intruding knight with a sharp dagger and pitchfork. You didnt know what to do, your mother kept yelling, "Run!" But you stayed stock still in shock. The pleads for your flight ended as the shaft of an arrow appeared in her heart. You roared in rage and terror. The roar shock all the walls, caused the soldiers to cover there ears. Then in a fury you attacked the bowman and clawed him to ribbons. Your anger and blood lust subsided and you realized what you had just done. Crazed, you look around quickly. All the soldiers aimed bows and spears and sword points at you. All shouting horrible names. You spread your wings and leaped skyward, weapons struck where your prone figure had been, inpaling the already shredded body of the bowman. Arrows whizzed by, spears cut through the air inches away... And all seemed lost. Doom itself seemed to embrace you like a cold blanket of death. No more! No more abue you could take, no more pain could you suffer! Your wings pounded the air, arrows struck a your rear legs, one cut through the thin membrane of your wing. But the real pain came from agian seeing your foster perants, the only people who ever cared for you that you knew of, lying dead on the cobble stones. You flew straight for the only safe havean you knew of, the outcrop.

All alone, no one to guide you, questions left unanswered. Where do you go at a time like this?

"It could mean only one of two things. Either this lord of fire hired thugs to kill people who take this road or a certain Angel of Death is nearby. If it is who I think it is then there is good reason why he's here on a road." Dasuke said as he transformed into his dragon form.

"What's this attached to this tree. It looks like a note? Zania pondered as she approached the tree.

Zania carefully removes the note from the tree. She then opens the note. She notices that it is written in red. She then proceeds to read it.

         To whomever finds this note take heed. According to a prophecy written long ago war is inevitable. The prophecy states that the Half-god Emotion will conspire with humanity to merge him with his older twin Duty. By then the Goddess Order will reawaken in the form of a human woman. In four months time Emotion will gather an army of faithful servants. Unfortunately this means that my evil brother plans on reversing the curse that separated us. If we were to be merged into one being again the world will truly plunge into disorder. If that ever happens you must awaken the Goddess Order. I'll do what I can to prevent Shen from fulfilling his plot for revenge. One more thing you should know if you can't tell the differences between me and him. This note that you're reading now is how I'll talk to you. My brother loves to hear himself speak so that should be a dead giveaway between us. If he is posing as me then our dragon forms will be the last indicator. In dragon form I have a black hide and blood red underbelly. Shen has a red hide and a black underbelly. May you fare well on your journey.

Sincerely,

Ken Marens.

Before Sabrina could say something the bushes started rustling.

A few years have passed since Dasuke and his companions defeated Shen Marens. Knowing that it was impossible to kill the half-god Dasuke lent Sabrina his sword to trigger Keith's imprisonment tome. After Shen was imprisoned he bid farewell to his comrades briefly. With sword in tow he walked towards the mountains. Yet once in a while he did run into his friends, except Ken who always stuck to the shadows. He enjoyed the casual pace that he started to put on weight in his dragon form.

At first he was embarrassed, but when Sabrina started to cuddle up to him he pretty much accepted the weight gain. It was bound to happen sooner or later. Now in his 20s Dasuke was a whooping seven tons, yet he's still somewhat small for a Devourer, but that is due to being both part human and part Halfling. His breed of dragon doesn't develop the Devourer traits until their late teens or early twenties. He won't gain a lot of weight in human form until his mid twenties or early 30s or if he decides to fully adopt the Devourer lifestyle.

However, Dasuke had things to do. There has been one thing that always bugged him. Is he truly the last Halfling or are things not what they seem? Considering that Halflings seamlessly blend into human society, there may be more of his kind then what others let on. He's almost certain that some of the king's men are probably Halflings themselves. He's almost certain that Sir Alexander Gemstone was a Halfling himself, for he and his sister called themselves shapeshifters and never would go into battle with their respective weapons.

Right now Dasuke was walking into town in his human form. Despite preferring his dragon form he didn't want people going out of their way just to rub his stomach and feed him. The last thing he wanted to do was eat the entire town clean. The last time that happened he sold a pelt that he shed. The pelt was more than enough to feed the town for five years, but he felt guilty despite the townspeople saying otherwise.

Dasuke briefly paused and pulled out a parchment stamped with the royal seal. It was an invitation to a ball on Halfling acceptance. He was invited to speak on behalf of his species. Afterwards he was asked to help the princess's committee revise the jurisdiction by establishing laws for fair treatment for Halflings. This included a jury full of both humans and Halflings. Dasuke sighs before putting the parchment away.

"Times are starting to change. It would be a relief to meet others who are Halfings or part Halfling. If I could find that out then I won't have to search for answers about my kin." Dasuke said to himself as he looked around.

Dasuke looked around to see if there was anyone he knew. He then felt someone place a hand on his shoulder. Dasuke turned around to see Sabrina Mathis standing behind him or so he thought. He then heard the shouting of a maiden.

"Keith! How dare you create a clone of me!"

Dasuke sees Sabrina chasing Keith with an arrow loaded on her bow.

"You need to lighten up! The clone is only temporary!"

Dasuke then looks back at the Sabrina clone. Her eyes turned pitch black and there were fumes coming off her body.

Better dispose of this clone before she explodes.

Dasuke quickly transforms and attempts to swallow the exploding clone. Once the clone was in his mouth it exploded, but the explosion wasn't as dangerous as he thought. Instead of damaging his mouth he tasted chocolate for some reason. Dasuke sensually moaned as he swallowed the chocolate remains of the clone.

"That's the best chocolate I've tasted in years."

"Chocolate? Chocolate!"

"Yes Sabrina, I made the clone out of chocolate. It was the least dangerous substance I could think of."

Sabrina responds by slapping Keith across the face. Keith stumbled backwards due to Sabrina's impressive strength. Unlike most women, Sabrina had some pretty impressive muscles and a pair of four-pack abs.

"You could have almost killed Dasuke!"

"It's ok Sabrina. Keith sure does know how to make some fine chocolate."

"Thanks Suki! It's my mother's secret recipe. Speaking of my mother I believe she's writing a magical cookbook."

"That's cool. What brings you two here?"

"Same as you Dasuke."

"Really? I just met a gorgeous gal who's totally into me."

"What girl would court a psychopath like you?" Sabrina asked sarcastically.

"A princess who's not human." Keith replied.

"You mean the king's daughter? I've heard rumors that the royal families may be of hybrid dragon blood, but nobody has confirmed it and those who work with the royal family took a vow of silence."

"Don't believe me. I'm sure the princess will tell you tonight. I have to get ready for the ball. See you lovebirds later!"

Keith then disappears in a puff of smoke.

"That guy really pisses me off. I thought he would of gotten saner by now, but he got worse."

"Calm down Sabrina. Keith is just trying to have some fun."

Sabrina sighs as she leans against Dasuke.

"If what he is saying is true, than I'm getting as far away as possible. The last thing we need is a nutcase as king."

"I'm fine. I have to give a certain magician a piece of my mind. See you later Dasuke."
